reviewText:
Early Access Review

Sketch Tales is based on a brilliant idea - a sandbox RPG where you can draw, animate and even voice things while in-game.

But you can completely ignore that, if you wish. There's fun to be had no matter how you approach the game - landscapes designed for exploration, quests to find and perform, structures to build, beasts to kill and loot to hunt.

I spent my first hour just wandering around in confusion with a goofy grin. I was chased by enemies who muttered daft things at me or played the harmonica. I laughed as I killed something whose body span comically down the hill. I picked up a quest from an NPC who then randomly wandered off to fight a ninja. The whole thing is a living, breathing cartoon that oozes charm.

My blind let's play" video of my first game: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4eqT1-DvBbw

You'll need to consider a few things before buying the game close to the early access release date:

1. Early Access here means that - it's very early days yet. There's lots to things to do
date: but not much depth. Just exploring the one island won't take long
recommended: but you can spend as much time as you want building and drawing etc.\n\n2. The drawing element is essentially an in-game paint programme
hoursPlayed: with the ability to add basic animation frames if you want. Right now you can edit/draw anything you're holding in your inventory (if you have picked up the Witch Brush)
voteText: plus you get to draw your character when you first start playing.\n\n3. There'll be bugs - unoptimised graphics
votesHelpful: features that don't seem to work - but they'll get fixed. No full crashes
votesTotal: but did have to reload quite a bit to clear any built-up lag
votesFunny: though.\n\n4. The building isn't as intuitive as Minecraft
commentsCount: with (simple) menus to select shapes and so on
column16: but once you get the hang of it you can build blocky structures easily. You can alter the default cube to stuff like ramps
column17: arches and flat bits too.\n\n5. You don't get given all the building/colouring tools at the start - you need to go out and find them in the world on scrolls. Plus
column19: which uses up very fast and then slowly fills back up again. You can find items that increase your max energy
column20:
but at the start of the game you're very limited (This applies to story mode - I don't know yet if sandbox mode will have this limitation).

6. Fighting is very basic. You start with fists but I recommend finding an axe!

Sketch Tales is already a lot of fun and shows amazing potential but right now it's very rough around the edges. I recommend it
column21: but I'm most interested in what's to come. Multiplayer
column23:
should be a riot.

* More Sketch Tales videos
* More Randomise User indie game videos

Thanks to the developers for providing a pre-release version for review."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I sense much potential in this one, but its empty as ♥♥♥♥. What you're actually buying is probably the chance to buy it for a cheap price while its still empty. Game is buggy as my virus filled laptop and you start off without any knowledge of what to do and how to do it. There are little tips here and there and also a vague tutorial but thats about it. At the moment I'd rate it a 2/10 but its got the potential to be a 9/10.

Would I recommend it now as a game that can be played? Nope. Its Empty and Lonely. Although, If you're like me and like the concept of this game, go ahead and buy it! Support the game and give the devs some inspiration by showing them that people like their idea and want to see it to its fullest. Would I recommend it to people who are active in game development forums and want to help develop the game by simply buying it? Of Course I would!
voteText: 20 of 22 people (91%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Wonderful, innovative game that throws you into a colorless world of sketches and asks you to save them by retrieving their wonderful colors from evil's clutches.
I had a great time playing this cute indie adventure. I also lost myself during my character creation of a tailless Lizard man & I loved the ridiculously animated outcome. It works well with its simplistic graphics, the cute mousy voice overs & the eccentric lighthearted humor.
Daily updates & bug fixes of this early access game keep me coming back as well. It just goes to show you that you don't always need triple A graphics & millions of dollars to showcase true work of art.  I highly recommend this delightful game.
voteText: 14 of 17 people (82%) found this review helpful 1 person found this review funny

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The Survival Game everyone has always wanted.

Have you ever wondered how a survival game would actually be if some feature you would like to add would be truely added? Sketch Tales is the game that will give you this possibility.

Not many people have already noticed this piece of art but soon they will! About it, simply think about a survival game, make it 2D and very personalizable, in fact you can draw your character, your enemies and build their stories!

Also the trasformation of a 3D world in 2D is something completely new which will deserve your love. Very fun to play and very well done, the idea behind it is amazing. At the moment some bugs are there, but you can't really wait for them to be fixed to buy this game straight away, for the price it is served at it is an absolute Must Have!

I am looking forward confident of the success of this game, which will make this the next big Survival, EA, Open World game.

A specific word for the crafting and building system which work magnificently and it is already as good as RUST's one (RUST the survival game)!

Videogame Score: 9.0 | ULTRA RECOMMENDED

reviewText:
Early Access Review

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kvhvH7U0KZg

Sketch Tales is another addition to the realm of User-generated Open World content, such as the recent Codespells or the ever popular Minecraft. Sketch Tales is reminiscent of Minecraft in a stylistic sense. Where Minecraft is a blocky, basic but charming 3D Game; Sketch is a crudely drawn but just as lovable 2D World (for the most part, some things however such as blocks exist as 3D Elements which creates for a trippy contrast. My only real issue with the game right now would be a lack of a tutorial. I only managed to find out how to do everything from a video earlier today.

One to keep your eye on.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Sketch Tales is a good game, you can have fun thanks to the possibility to create whatever you want (of course within the limits of the game).
Gameplay very simple and functional, artistically beautiful to look at, but there is a huge flaw, ie the optimization!
With a I7 4790k + 980Ti + 16 GB Of RAM I found DECREASED FPS
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=oeY_OA6-YKY
(Below is the Italian full review)

Sketch Tales  è un gioco Sandbox in stile RPG action.. Hai bisogno di una spada? disegnala, hai bisogno di una azienda? disegnala.
Disegna qualsiasi creatura, essi prenderà vita!

Feature:
Immagina e disegna: puoi disegnare qualsiasi scarabocchio.. essi prenderà vita!

Nessun requisito artistico richiesto: per creare le proprie creature o oggetti non è mai stato così facile!

Liberta di scelta: crea un personaggio completamente unico, e scegli il percorso che preferisci

Moltra il tuo valore: combatti contro nemici, evita trappole mortali e anomalie magiche!

A breve nuove aggiunte!

Parere personale:
Sketch Tales è un buon gioco, che può divertire grazie alla possibilità di creare qualsiasi cosa si voglia ( ovviamente nei limiti del gioco).
Gameplay molto semplice e funzionale, artisticamente bello da vedere, ma c'è una pecca enorme, ovvero l'ottimizzazione!
Con un I7 4790k + 980Ti + 16 GB Di ram ho riscontrato CALI DI FPS, una cosa indegna direi, anche perché l'ho provato in full HD.

Direi che il gioco è un 50 e 50, se avete un pc di fascia media evitatelo assolutamente, o almeno aspettate futuri aggiornamenti.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

a game with infinite potential.
There goes without saying. It is strongly influenced by minecraft and dont starve. But the special twist in it makes it unique.
My graphic tablets work perfectly in there too, which adds to the magic.

There is something you may not have seen in it as a very unique potential. It could be a good ''first step'' to graphic tablets for younger people or newcomers to the digital art scene. As a father of 4 kids and as an illustration and 3d modeling artist, I totally see this game becoming huge in my household, and a perfect way to break the ice with graphic tablets for my kids. They will enjoy it and who knows, maybe want to go further using it.

This game also has a potential to be a new hype in schools, just like minecraft did. Bring it to tablets and im pretty sure you will find a solid audience.

Keep on working hard :-)

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nI can only compare this to reading a book. You know how you make the image of the writers character up in your own mind while reading a book? And we each have our own different interpretation of that character visually? Well, this game is like that. It takes the story/sandbox and then makes you the creator of your characters.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Finally the game where you draw your own adventure! Pity I am only good with pencils, in this game you literally draw your characters and creatures into the world. It's made in the Unity engine so the water looks crazy good, good sound design. Procedurally Generated worlds, Gameplay combat mechanics remind me of Old School Duke Nukem + Doom + Elder Scrolls! KEEP AN EYE ON THIS ONE, once they round off some edges this will be fantastic!

30 Minutes or Less, this concept is just so damn cool!
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=O0MeMUpgHts&list=PLNtPp4M-LVW-RJYbhJha2iqZ7wSZOZI5H&index=2

Thanks so much for reading my review, Keep an eye on this one once the edges round off it will be a true treat!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

На момент написания этого обзора игра находится в раннем доступе. Очень раннем доступе.

Я могу порекомендовать эту игру если вы хотите чего-то необычного.
Самое необычное в игре это возможность полностью с нуля нарисовать, анимировать и озвучить своего персонажа. И даже не персонажа, а вообще почти любой игровой предмет. Внутриигровой редактор более чем функционален, на мелкие недоработки можно закрыть глаза.

В том что касается первого впечатления от самой игры, то это как будто Minecraft смешали с Don't Starve.
Но поскольку это ранний доступ" геймплея как такого особо не наблюдается

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nCreative, fun game that you can design and make as you explore. You can set up a home out of blocks that you've drawn, or use the defualt ones and give it a nice, worn-down look to it. It may be a little confusing at first to learn, but it's so interesting you have fun while learning. It is certainly not a finished game, but it's really fun to mess around with as an early access one.
